abstract: Pressure from NFL may have played role in ESPN's decision to withdraw from partnership with PBS in which it was producing documentary about league's contentious handling of concussions.
lead_paragraph: ESPN had been working with PBS on a film about head injuries in the National Football League, whose games are shown on the sports network and represent a cherished source of revenue.

byline.original: By JAMES ANDREW MILLER and KEN BELSON
byline.contributor: Brian Stelter and Richard Sandomir contributed reporting.

headline.main: N.F.L. Pressure Said to Lead ESPN to Quit Film Project
headline.print_headline: N.F.L. Said to Have Pressured ESPN

snippet: ESPN had been working with PBS on a film about head injuries in the National Football League, whose games are shown on the sports network and represent a cherished source of revenue....
